title: Golden naga

A **golden naga**, N, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is an adult [naga](/wiki/Naga "Naga") that is the sole monster of the class with the ability to cast [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spells "Monster spells").

A golden naga has a bite attack and will attempt to cast one mage spell during each of its turns, and possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") a golden naga [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 2⁄3 chance (66%) of conveying poison resistance.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 Origin](#Origin)
- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Randomly-generated golden nagas may be created as peaceful towards lawful characters. A [golden naga hatchling](/wiki/Golden_naga_hatchling "Golden naga hatchling") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a golden naga.

Golden nagas appear among the N that are part of the second [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Rogues](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the the [Rogue quest](/wiki/Rogue_quest "Rogue quest").

## Strategy

Golden nagas are quick-moving monsters that can outpace an unhasted character, and are fairly dangerous spellcasters: their available spells usually include [destroy armor](/wiki/Destroy_armor_\(monster_spell\) "Destroy armor (monster spell)"), [curse items](/wiki/Curse_items "Curse items") and [drain strength](/wiki/Drain_strength "Drain strength"), and it may cast [haste self](/wiki/Haste_self_\(monster_spell\) "Haste self (monster spell)") and/or [disappear](/wiki/Disappear "Disappear") before you can catch sight of it. [Magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") can blunt the worst of their spells' impact.

Lawful characters are likely to encounter peaceful golden nagas, which is often an advantage versus characters of other alignments.

## History

The golden naga first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Nāga](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/N%C4%81ga "wikipedia:Nāga")***

The Nāga (feminine "Nagi") are a supernatural race of half-human half-serpent beings that can occasionally take human form, and hold cultural significance in the folkloric traditions of many South Asian and Southeast Asian cultures over the past two millennia. Nagas also appear in *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*.

Their most common depiction is that of a snake with a human head, which the default tileset of *NetHack* draws from—other iconographic depictions portray them as human from the waist up and snake from the waist down, wholly human with snakes on the heads and necks, or even as common serpents. Various south and southeastern Asian cultures also portray Nāgas as having multiple usually-serpentine heads.

## Encyclopedia entry

The naga is a mystical creature with the body of a snake and the head of a man or woman. They will fiercely protect the territory they consider their own. Some nagas can be forced to serve as guardians by a spellcaster of great power.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Golden naga

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
N golden naga
Difficulty 13
Attacks Bite 2d6 physical, Spell-casting 4d6 mage
N golden naga
Difficulty 13
Attacks

Bite 2d6 physical, Spell-casting 4d6 mage

Base level 10
Base experience 239
Speed 14
Base AC 2
Base MR 70
Alignment 5 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 2600
Nutritional value 400
Size Huge
Resistances Poison
Resistances conveyed Poison (66%)

A golden naga:

  • cannot pick up items.
  • has no limbs.
  • has a serpent body.
  • has a thick hide.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is strong.
Reference monst.c#line1642

A golden naga, N, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is an adult naga that is the sole monster of the class with the ability to cast monster spells.

A golden naga has a bite attack and will attempt to cast one mage spell during each of its turns, and possesses poison resistance.

Eating a golden naga corpse or tin has a 2⁄3 chance (66%) of conveying poison resistance.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Origin
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

Randomly-generated golden nagas may be created as peaceful towards lawful characters. A golden naga hatchling can grow up into a golden naga.

Golden nagas appear among the N that are part of the second quest monster class for Rogues, and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the the Rogue quest.

Strategy

Golden nagas are quick-moving monsters that can outpace an unhasted character, and are fairly dangerous spellcasters: their available spells usually include destroy armor, curse items and drain strength, and it may cast haste self and/or disappear before you can catch sight of it. Magic resistance can blunt the worst of their spells' impact.

Lawful characters are likely to encounter peaceful golden nagas, which is often an advantage versus characters of other alignments.

History

The golden naga first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Nāga

The Nāga (feminine "Nagi") are a supernatural race of half-human half-serpent beings that can occasionally take human form, and hold cultural significance in the folkloric traditions of many South Asian and Southeast Asian cultures over the past two millennia. Nagas also appear in Dungeons & Dragons.

Their most common depiction is that of a snake with a human head, which the default tileset of NetHack draws from—other iconographic depictions portray them as human from the waist up and snake from the waist down, wholly human with snakes on the heads and necks, or even as common serpents. Various south and southeastern Asian cultures also portray Nāgas as having multiple usually-serpentine heads.

Encyclopedia entry

The naga is a mystical creature with the body of a snake and the head of a man or woman. They will fiercely protect the territory they consider their own. Some nagas can be forced to serve as guardians by a spellcaster of great power.

A '''golden naga''', {{monsym|golden naga}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is an adult [[naga]] that is the sole monster of the class with the ability to cast [[monster spells]].

A golden naga has a bite attack and will attempt to cast one mage spell during each of its turns, and possesses [[poison resistance]].

[[Eating]] a golden naga [[corpse]] or [[tin]] has a {{frac|2|3}} chance (66%) of conveying poison resistance.

==Generation==
Randomly-generated golden nagas may be created as peaceful towards lawful characters. A [[golden naga hatchling]] can [[grow up]] into a golden naga.

Golden nagas appear among the {{white|N}} that are part of the second [[quest]] monster class for [[Rogue]]s, and make up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the the [[Rogue quest]].

==Strategy==
Golden nagas are quick-moving monsters that can outpace an unhasted character, and are fairly dangerous spellcasters: their available spells usually include [[Destroy armor (monster spell)|destroy armor]], [[curse items]] and [[drain strength]], and it may cast [[Haste self (monster spell)|haste self]] and/or [[disappear]] before you can catch sight of it. [[Magic resistance]] can blunt the worst of their spells' impact.

Lawful characters are likely to encounter peaceful golden nagas, which is often an advantage versus characters of other alignments.

==History==
The golden naga first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Origin==
{{Wikipedia|Nāga}}
The Nāga (feminine "Nagi") are a supernatural race of half-human half-serpent beings that can occasionally take human form, and hold cultural significance in the folkloric traditions of many South Asian and Southeast Asian cultures over the past two millennia. Nagas also appear in ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]''.

Their most common depiction is that of a snake with a human head, which the default tileset of ''NetHack'' draws from—other iconographic depictions portray them as human from the waist up and snake from the waist down, wholly human with snakes on the heads and necks, or even as common serpents. Various south and southeastern Asian cultures also portray Nāgas as having multiple usually-serpentine heads.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|<poem>
The naga is a mystical creature with the body of a snake and the head of a man or woman.  They will fiercely protect the territory they consider their own.  Some nagas can be forced to serve as guardians by a spellcaster of great power.
</poem>}}
